title: Iran Says US Will Bear "Full Responsibility" For Israeli Retaliation
description: Iran on Monday warned the United States would bear "full responsibility" in case of a retaliatory attack by Israel on the Islamic Republic, after US President Joe Biden indicated he was aware of Israeli plans to do so.

title: Blinken Heads To Middle East As Israel Intensifies Strikes In Lebanon
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken left for the Middle East Monday on a new push for an elusive Gaza ceasefire two weeks before US elections, seeing a new opportunity from Israel's killing of Hamas's leader.

title: Lebanon says four dead in Israeli strike near southern Beirut hospital
description: Thirteen air strikes hit locations in southern Beirut on Monday evening, authorities said.

title: Israel still preventing humanitarian missions to north Gaza, Unrwa says
description: Israeli forces are besieging hospitals and shelters, medics say. The Israeli military says Hamas has regrouped in the area.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: China tightens export controls for tech and goods with military use, ahead of Xi's trip to Russia
description: China unveiled a set of regulations on export control of goods and technologies that could be used for military purposes.

title: Microsoft to roll out new autonomous AI agents next month, fending off challenge from Salesforce
description: Microsoft will allow organizations to create their own autonomous AI agents within Copilot starting next month.

title: Video shows Israeli strike on crowd of people trying to help wounded boy
description: Seconds after people rushed to help a 13-year-old boy grievously wounded from a strike in northern Gaza, another strike hit a few feet away.
author: Evan Hill

title: Israeli airstrikes hit near Beirut hospital
author: Meg Kelly, Mohamad El Chamaa

title: Mideast Crisis Updates: Israel Carries Out Another Round of Strikes Near Lebanese Capital
description: The attacks followed claims from the Israeli military that Hezbollah was operating a command center beneath a hospital in a densely populated neighborhood near Beirut in which it holds sway. The Israeli military issued evacuation warnings for other buildings in the neighborhood, and deafening explosions were later heard.
author: The New York Times

title: Paul Whelan’s Life in a Russian Prison Awaiting a Hostage Swap
description: The former U.S. Marine describes the moment of his arrest and the long years waiting for his release.
author: Neil MacFarquhar

title: McDonald’s workers roast Trump over ‘insulting cosplay’ fry cook stunt - The Independent
description: McDonald’s workers roast Trump over ‘insulting cosplay’ fry cook stunt  The IndependentMcDonald’s didn’t give Trump permission to serve fries. It didn’t need to  CNNBrit Hume says Trump ‘pulled off’ the campaign event at McDonalds  Fox NewsMcDonald's is distancing itself from Donald Trump after a high-profile visit to the fryer  QuartzColumn | No, McDonald’s didn’t confirm Trump’s baseless claim about Kamala Harris  The Washington Post

title: Biden is 'deeply concerned' about the release of secret documents on Israel's possible attack plans - The Associated Press
description: Biden is 'deeply concerned' about the release of secret documents on Israel's possible attack plans  The Associated PressInitial investigation into US intelligence leak on Israeli attack planning focusing on who had access to documents  CNNU.S. Investigates Intelligence Leak About Israel’s Plans for Attacking Iran  The Wall Street JournalDOD, FBI investigating suspected major intelligence leak  ABC NewsBiden ‘concerned’ about release of files on Israel’s plans to strike Iran  Al Jazeera English

title: Millions of teenagers in Africa have undiagnosed asthma – study
description: Rapid urbanisation thought to be damaging adolescent health, as researchers say need for medication and diagnostic tests is urgentMillions of teenagers in Africa are suffering from asthma with no formal diagnosis as the continent undergoes rapid urbanisation, researchers have found.The study, published in the Lancet Child and Adolescent Health, involved 27,000 pupils from urban areas in Malawi, South Africa, Zimbabwe, Uganda, Ghana and Nigeria. It found more than 3,000 reported asthma symptoms, but only about 600 had a formal diagnosis. Continue reading...
author: Kat Lay Global health correspondent

title: Despair in Chad camps as violence and hunger in Sudan drive 25,000 across border in a week
description: Warning of ‘lost generation’ in Adré and Farchana camps as Sudan’s civil war drives huge numbers across borderWhat caused the civil war in Sudan and how has it become one of the world’s worst humanitarian crises?Refugees and aid agencies have warned of deteriorating conditions in overcrowded and severely underfunded camps in Chad, as intensifying violence and a hunger crisis in Sudan drive huge numbers across the border.About 25,000 people – the vast majority women and children – crossed into eastern Chad in the first week of October, a record number for a single week in 2024. Chad, one of the world’s poorest countries, hosts 681,944 Sudanese refugees – the highest number globally. Continue reading...
author: Zeinab Mohammed Salih in Adré and Farchana

title: Israel says it 'eliminated' Hezbollah finance chief in Syria
description: The Israeli military announced it eliminated a Hezbollah commander overseeing the group’s finances in Syria and intensified strikes on Hezbollah’s financial infrastructure in Lebanon. This follows the killing of the unit’s former leader and targeted financial institutions accused of funding military activities to halt Hezbollah’s capacity and support of Hamas.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Israel strikes Hezbollah-affiliated financial branches across Lebanon
description: The Israeli military launched air strikes targeting Al-Qard al-Hasan branches in Lebanon, linked to Hezbollah, to disrupt their financial operations and weaken support. This escalation aims to impede Hezbollah’s activities by hitting its financial network, impacting their ability to function amid Lebanon's ongoing crisis.
author: Ephrat Livni and Euan Ward

title: Ancient meteorite was 'giant fertilizer bomb' for life on Earth
Two Navy pilots killed in jet crash had recently returned from Middle East deployment
